reviews.review_msg: Jillian has been one of my favourite SFU professors so far. SA 337 is an extremely interesting course and Jillian does an amazing job of opening up students minds to new concepts. I wouldn't take this class for an easy A... you must attend every lecture and really care and understand material in order to do well. Would highly recommend!

What a wonderful teacher! She gives out her criteria and the due dates at the very start of the semester and everything is detailed! She is super sweet and amazing, and open minded. She loves to hear what you have to say and encourages anyone to speak up so don't be afraid!

Jillian was amazing!!! She has no PowerPoints so its so much easier to take notes from just what she talked about. She always wrote the important stuff on the board as well. There werent any tests and the projects were easy. Shes so friendly and nice!!! You dont really need the text since theres no exam. Just make sure to watch the films etc!!!

Jillian is a great prof that cares about her students. Classes are really interesting and engaging, and she always speaks to you with respect and an open mind. Attendance is pretty important but you won't want to miss class. Taking gwst 495 with her was one of the best decisions I made during my undergrad. p.s. I'm not a keener - at all.
Jillian was a great professor. Her lectures were very clear and straight-forward, her tests were fair, and she was always available for help.

she is awesome! i wish she had given criteria/better criteria for things. also i think she should have posted her powerpoints in a pdf instead of powerpoint files but im just picky! shes really cool and makes sure the students know the material. doesnt always give percent mark, some times just letter grade which was weird. i recommend the class tho

I took SA 150 with Jillian Deri, and it was hands down the best class iv taken at sfu! She is very passionate about course and keeps the lectures interesting. The papers very long but over exams arent  hard if you study. Although the profs amazing.. it still all depends on the TA.
Jillian is awesome. Must take her class. My TA is awesome too!!

Shes the nicest professor I have met in SFU. She treats students like her equals. I hope every professor was like her. Choose her as your TA- shes just amazing.  Pretty clear-cut class that inspires you in many ways.

My TA was a tough marker, and I hate sociology in general so I hate the class, but Jillian is really an excellent prof. She's passionate, cares about students, crystal clear in lectures and does not hesitate to help you if you need it. She's anything but boring. Tests are based off definitions of terms in book, memorize them and you'll be good.

I should've rated this prof and class sooner... it was quite enjoyable. I believe it was worth 4 credits too. Jillian showed a video of a friend of hers who had transitioned from male to female, and it was very inspirational. She wasn't afraid of difficult questions or naivety. I have a lot of respect for that. She was sweet, though often awkward.

Jillian is a very nice teacher. You can tell she enjoys teaching it. Although the videos she shows are interesting, I found her class pretty boring. I rarely listened. Her tests are short, but make sure you know your material!

Awesome professor, enthusiastic and will give everyone an A if you show that you're interested and understand material. Basically no homework in her class; but it is important to attend classes because she shows interesting material throughout the semester.

Jillian is passionate about Sociology and provides various video clips that leave you thinking. The course content is extremely easy because this stuff surrounds us in our social environments. Her lectures are straight word-for-word from the textbook. Contribute and pay attention in class and you are good to go! Definitely an easy course!
